question: Can you send someone else or skip your duty if you are called to serve on a jury?
possible_answers: A. Yes, you can send your spouse to serve on your behalf.
B. No, jury duty is a responsibility of citizenship that cannot be transferred or skipped.
C. Yes, you can skip jury duty if you inform the court in advance.
D. No, but you can hire someone to serve on the jury for you.
main_question: Can you send someone else or skip your duty if you are called to serve on a jury?
answer: B. No, jury duty is a responsibility of citizenship that cannot be transferred or skipped.
explanatory_sentence: When called to do so, you are legally required to serve. Serving on a jury is a privilege that makes the justice system work as it depends on impartial juries made up of citizens.
